"I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on," Andy Coulson said in a statement announcing his resignation. Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, he added. The 43-year-old-- a key figure in David Cameron 's inner circle who helped propel the Conservative leader to power in elections in May 2010-- later left Downing Street without speaking to reporters.

global warming. By burning all agricultural waste such as corn and rice stalks, branch and leaf litter( as well as animal dung) in a "low-oxygen" environment to create charcoal, we could halt the increase and actually decrease the level of atmospheric carbon by 0.7 gigatonnes a year, according to Johannes Lehmann , a soil science expert at Cornell University. The bonus is that charcoal in the soil tends to increase crop yields, too. 3 comments from readers Simon Cowell Divine 16 January 2011

in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks
